label: A3B2C7_oF48_69_ag_g_bgl-001
title: Orthorhombic La$_{3}$Ni$_{2}$O$_{7}$ Structure
comments:
La$_{3}$Ni$_{2}$O$_{7-\delta}$ is a Ruddlesden-Popper compound with a bilayer NiO$_{6}$ structure.  The exact structure depends on the pressure and/or oxygen deficiency. (Park, 2001; Lin, 2024) \begin{itemize} \item Under ambient pressure the fully stoichiometric compound is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A7B2C3_oC48_63_c2eg_g_cg-001}{Sr$_{3}$SnO$_{7}$ structure}. \item At pressures above $\approx$ 10$\,$GPa or when $\delta \approx \,$0.06 it is in the current structure. \item As $\delta$ increases the system transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/A7B3C2_tI24_139_aeg_be_e-001}{tetragonal Sr$_{3}$Ti$_{2}$O$_{7}$ structure}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 (Sun, 2023) report ``signatures'' of superconductivity in this structure at 80$\,$K at pressures between 14 and 43.5$\,$GPa. 
 The data for this structure was taken from (Park, 2001) at ambient pressure, and the oxygen (2b) site has 4\% vacancies. 
 The AFLOW prototype label algorithm swaps the a and c axis compared to experiment, and moves the origin from the O I site to the La I site. 
 This structure is a ternary form of the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C2D_oF48_69_g_agl_g_b-001}{SrLa$_{2}$Sc$_{2}$O$_{7}$ structure}.
